result.subject: Mothly Router Publication
result.message_html:
Broadband Router Publication

The broadband router's NAT (Network Address Translation) firewall filters out unrecognized packets to protect your intranet. All hosts behind this firewall are invisible externally. Enabling the Virtual Server Mapping will make some of the host's ports accessible.

A virtual server is defined as a Service Port. All requests to this port will be redirected to the PC that is specified by the Server IP.

Port forwarding sets up public services on your network. When Internet users make requests on your network, the broadband router will forward those requests to the appropriate computer. The broadband router's DHCP function must be disabled to use port forwarding. Port forwarding is generally used to set up a webserver, ftp server, or e-mail server on your network.

To add a server using Forwarding, perform the following steps:

  1. Enter the port number and the IP Address of the server that you want to allow Internet users to access.
  2. Configure as many entries as desired until all the entries are filled in.
  3. Click Apply in order to save the settings.

For example, if you have an FTP server (port 21) at 192.168.123.1, a Web server (port 80) at 192.168.123.2, and a PPTP VPN server at 192.168.123.6, you need to specify the following virtual server mapping table:

Service Port
Server IP
Enable
20 192.168.123.1 V
21 192.168.123.1 V
80 192.168.123.2 V
1723 192.168.123.6 V
result.name: Publication Sample

result.subject: ServiceNow Subscription Management Application – Per-User Subscription Received
result.message_html:
Subscription Management - The ServiceNow Subscription Management application within your instance provides visibility to your ServiceNow subscriptions and the ability to specify your subscribed users. Not all ServiceNow subscription products are available within Subscription Management at this time, and some may currently be Display Only. The Subscription Management application product entries in no way change or override your ServiceNow contract.

Available for Allocation - Your "${name}" subscription product is now available and ready for user allocation. To view and allocate users to the subscription product, navigate to the Subscription Management application on your production instance or click ${URI_REF} to be taken there directly.

Learn More - Learn more by visiting the product documentation at: Subscription Management Product Documentation

Notification Distribution - This email is sent to users with the usage_admin role. If no users have this role, the notification is sent to users with the admin role.
result.name: Per-User Subscription Created
